summary_comment: Professor Burton is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and deep knowledge of the subject matter. Her classes are engaging and encourage active participation, particularly through group projects. Students find her courses manageable with good preparation and involvement but note that attendance is crucial. Overall, her teaching is praised for its quality and relevance, making her courses both informative and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: Took this class in SP21. Easy A if you participate and do your work on group projects. Lectures were interesting, and Professor Burton is more than qualified to teach on the subject.
Class felt too easy. Attendance is important.
I enjoyed her Planning for Future Cities course. Expect a lot of conversation and group work. Overall it was an interesting elective.

summary_comment: Professor Charles is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors at OSU, particularly for the required GIS class. Students find his teaching style confusing and his grading criteria unclear. He focuses heavily on ArcMap, which many find outdated and less user-friendly compared to other ESRI software. The class is described as demanding and overwhelming, with students struggling to keep up and seeking additional help outside of class, which is rarely available. Overall, the consensus is that his teaching methods and course content are subpar and

Ratings.comment: Charles is by far one of the worst professors I have ever had at OSU so it's a shame that this is a required class. Every person I know who has taken this class has hated it. He is impossible to reach outside of class (literally), has no clear grading criteria, and only teaches arcmap which is so much clunkier than other esri software. -100/10

He did not teach the full scope of what GIS really is. There were two issues pertaining to that. The class was only a 2 hr credit course and he only used ARCGIS for our gis exploration, when there are so many other ARC applications and capability through esri. Class kinda sucked for the reasons abov and he did not really teach just did how tos
People complain about him going too fast in class, but he will help anyone outside of class at any moment. People who do poorly were expecting to get good grades just for turning in projects.

You must focus every second to what he is saying. If you miss any detail good luck with the lab assignments, which are extremely tough and vague as well. He refused to help me outside of class and was never at his own office hours. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND taking the GIS class through the Geography School instead of with Cartwright.

He's awful. I read these reviews prior to taking his class and thought everyone was just exaggerating.Everything here is true though. He's unclear, requires inordinate amounts of work for a 1 hour class and makes absolutely no sense when lecturing. Avoid!

Professor Cartwright is a great teacher for the City and Regional Planning department. He is very easy to understand and really knows what he's talking about. He is also very willing to help with any problems you have. His class requires a lot of time and effort, but the amount you learn makes it worth it.

Made an already new topic difficult. I honestly believe he makes things confusing and difficult for job security. Honestly, anyone who read the textbook throughly could teach the course just as well, if not better. Also and exam of 35 questions where 1 is worth 40% of the grade... come on.

This is one of the worst teachers at knowlton.  He uses PowerPoint to teach math problems and does not work them out. The examples given in class do not reflect what are on the HWs, so everyone gets bad grades on the HWs and he doesnâ??t care. You are given hundreds of pages to read and the exam questions are unimportant points in the reads that yo

Does not give good explanations on powerpoint math equations (which also have a ton of errors). Complained to entire class that grades were not good..doesn't that say something about the professor? Class was to be linked to design studio but is not. Class is to build a trash can, aka waste of time! 3 cred class with a work load of a 4.5 cred class.

summary_comment: Professor Paula offers a generally satisfactory teaching experience, though her class can be challenging due to inconsistent instructions from other instructors. Students should seek clarification multiple times to ensure understanding. The Teaching Assistants play a crucial role in providing guidance and support, making it essential for students to build a positive relationship with them. Overall, while the class requires active engagement and questioning, Professor Paula's lectures are considered valuable.

Ratings.comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS FOR A G.E. CREDIT. Paula is pretty okay but the class is confusing because every instructor gives you different instructions so make sure to asked twice and even three times. your TA is your best tool, make sure to get along with them and listen to their advice.

summary_comment: John Davis is an exceptional lecturer known for his engaging style, which captivates even the most disinterested students. His approachable and fun demeanor makes the subject matter enjoyable, and many students express a desire to take his classes repeatedly.

Ratings.comment: John Davis is such a good lecturer, even topics I usually don't care for I still pay attention when he's giving his take. He's really down to earth and fun, I wish I could take his class every semester.

summary_comment: Bryan is a knowledgeable and skilled professor who focuses on practical application, particularly through Revit, making his seminar worth the credit. While he may not appear passionate about the material, he is highly supportive and helpful when students engage with him. His grading is relatively lenient, primarily based on participation and a final project, which can be completed with minimal in-class attention. Overall, his teaching quality is strong, though his enthusiasm for the subject matter is less evident.

Ratings.comment: Bryan seems like he doesn't really care about what he's teaching, but when you ask him a question, hes very helpful and is there for you. He grades pretty easily and doesn't really care that you don't pay attention in class. I never did and taught myself everything the night before the final project was due. He is very knowledgeable and skilled.

This seminar was definitely worth it to learn Revit, especially since it is an easy A and is only graded based on participation and a final project. The final is recreating a preexisting house on Revit using the new concepts and graphic skills you learn. Honestly, the prettier it looks at the end, the better your grade.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by a caring approach and a genuine desire to assist students in understanding the material. Students consistently praise her for providing valuable feedback and being willing to offer additional support outside of class hours.

Ratings.comment: Love her! she's so caring and she actually wants to help you out and understand.
Tameka is awesome! Her feedback is really helpful, she cares a lot, and is willing to help outside of class if you ask.

summary_comment: Professor Meyer is highly regarded for his clarity and friendliness, making complex software concepts accessible to students. His teaching style is engaging and he is very supportive, ensuring students understand the material. His classes are project-based, focusing on practical applications rather than theoretical knowledge, with grades determined by final projects. While the class can be challenging, particularly towards the end, students find it valuable and appreciate his expertise and assistance.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Meyer is super clear, friendly, and helpful. The software he teaches can be difficult, but he will always help you and make things clear. He should be teaching 3150 for Cartwright.

Very different than any class I've taken at OSU so far. The class consists of projects throughout the semester. Most of what to do in these is covered in class. You won't know your grade until the last week. The class also runs on WordPress, not Canvas. The professor himself is charismatic, skilled in the software he teaches, and very helpful.

Took this course in SP21. Only grades in the class are the 5 final projects that you work on throughout the semester. Don't wait until the end. Good professor, good class. A bit boring at times, but you learn how to use some very valuable softwares. Adobe PS, Illustrator, and Indesign are a staple for this class.

summary_comment: Ethan is highly regarded as one of the best freshman studio professors, known for his kindness, willingness to help, and inspirational teaching style. Students praise his excellent feedback and dedication to their success. However, the class requires consistent attendance and a significant amount of work. While some students appreciate his flexible approach to assignments, others find his generosity in grading standards occasionally lenient. Overall, Ethan is considered an outstanding instructor who leaves students well-prepared for future studio classes.

Ratings.comment: Ethan is a seriously underrated freshman studio professor. He is super nice and is always willing to help his students. I was never afraid to ask questions or his opinion on my work. But just like all of the studio classes, attendance is a must and the workload is fairly heavy. My only complaint is that sometimes he is almost too nice.

I can't say enough good things about Ethan!  He's so nice, and seriously cares so much for his students, his feedback is great, and is willing to give lots of help to whoever asks for it. My only advice is to be at every single class, and ALWAYS have your project finished. I only saw him get upset when kids didn't finish assignments/skipped class

By FAR the best 2310 professor you can get!!! Gives great feedback, very inspirational, and he really cares about his students. He will definitely leave you well prepared for future studio classes! However, this class (no matter the professor) is a TONNNN of work!! Don't take if you don't have to. Not a good 'just for fun' elective.
Ethan was such an inspiration. There were times I didn't believe in myself and he proved me wrong. Such a great teacher and he really does care for his students. Amazing guy.

ARCH 2310 is a lot of work, as all architecture courses are. Ethan is amazing & definitely the best of the entry level professors, wish I could have him for every class. Take this class with him, but don't take this class if you don't have to. Lots of work but rewarding .. Never ever skip

He is the best freshman studio teacher. He doesnt give hard requirments for assignments but rather lets creativity lead. If you can explain why you didnt follow the rules, than you dont have to follow them. He was very kind with me when I missed class due to illness and helped make sure I stayed caught up. I wouldnt have passed without him.

HE IS THE MAN! No doubt the best teacher ever. Super nice and very helpful feedback. He has an awesome sense of style and humor to keep class interesting. Very educated on the subject and is more then willing to help out if asked. Understands that deadlines are important but they also pile up and will move due dates if needed. I LOVE HIM.
Structured Information presentation

Ethan is a sweetheart. I think he is too nice to be honest and to the point I want him to be more critical (like Ben Wilke). But he gives you clear instructions and is really nice. But I do think feedback wise, the TAs were most helpful. He throws some cheesy jokes here and there sometimes with his cool mustache. missing deadlines is his petpeeve.

Ethan is the most relaxed and friendly out of all the intro Arch professors. He is very nice and willing to provide assistance or feedback. He gives the most instruction of all the 2310 professors and it is invaluable. He is a pretty easy grader, and pretty easy on critique- maybe easier than he should be. All in all, a really nice guy.

Additionally, he possessed a commendable sense of humor, which enhanced the learning experience and made the classes more enjoyable. Overall, his teaching quality was high, contributing significantly to the educational value of the course.

Ratings.comment: He was very knowledgable and you could tell he was interested in the subject. He had a good sense of humor too!

summary_comment: Professor Susan Melsop is highly regarded by students, with many praising her engaging and dynamic teaching style. Her service learning course and studio classes are particularly well-loved, though some note that she can be scattered and may show favoritism. Students appreciate her enthusiasm and dedication, even if it comes with a heavy workload, such as the extensive origami projects. However, her communication can be unclear, especially during group projects like the complex map assignment in the London Honors class. Overall, while

Ratings.comment: Service Learning Course was awsome.
Great lady,and she is a fun teacher. But a little scattered and tends to forget things. she also seems a little self conscious.. be sure to get on her good side because she does play favorites
One of my favs
SUSAN MELSOP IS A HOTT MESS!!!!! She totally fly. Awesome for studio. (yes, she will make you fold 8,000 pieces of origami. Workload = ugh. GO TEAM MELSOP!!!!!!!

Also had her for London Honors. The map project was stupid. Didn't really answer questions...you would give her a question with 2 choices and she would say "yes". I thought she was nice though, and as long as you put forth effort I think the grading was fair.

She taught our honors London class, which turned out to be an architecture project. Fortunately she was unable to go with us because of her back. All of the other groups did a simple project (or no project at ALL) but we were required to make this ridiculous map. She was NEVER clear on what she wanted and NEVER answered a question straightforward.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, as evidenced by students who found her engaging and supportive in her economics class. She is known for her willingness to assist students and adds a light-hearted touch with jokes and teasing during lectures. Despite being from Turkey, she communicates clearly and is not difficult to understand. Overall, she is viewed as a positive and enjoyable instructor.

Ratings.comment: great. i really liked her econ class! very willing to help and will joke/tease the class. foreign (Turkey) but not difficult to understand

summary_comment: Cadwell is considered a friendly and passionate professor with a unique teaching style, though some find his social awkwardness and tendency to laugh frequently annoying. He is respected for his contributions to the program despite these quirks. Mike is described as a genuinely nice and caring instructor with interesting ideas, though his lectures can be repetitive and sometimes boring, particularly for those uninterested in tectonics. Despite this, he is highly regarded among students. One comment suggests he may be gay, but no other details

Ratings.comment: Cadwell is a good guy, i just wish he wasn't so socially inept. He has the tendency to laugh about everything and it gets annoying. He has a tendency to have favored students who become a priority to awards, etc. I still find him a great part of the program regardless.
Friendly, interesting, and passionate about what he does. Has an elegant and poetic attitude toward architecture. I would put him in KSA's top 5 as well.

Mike is a really great guy and full of really interesting ideas once you get past all of the awkward silences and riiiiiight's. You have to be pretty interested in tectonics, because he's certainly not a Kipnisean theorist type. He's good though, and certainly in the top 5 for studio profs here.
Mike is a nice guy and he really cares about what he is teaching, but he is very boring at times and often repetative. And I'm pretty sure he is gay.
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his profound insights into architecture, often described as the most intellectually stimulating teacher students have encountered. His lectures are challenging and theoretical, pushing students to think deeply and critically. While some find his teachings confusing and impractical, others appreciate his intelligence and ability to simplify complex ideas. His feedback on projects is rigorous and often harsh, but students acknowledge the value in his critiques. Overall, his classes demand a high level of intellectual engagement and self-confidence.

Ratings.comment: Unbelievable insight into architecture. Sees and diagrams architecture at a seminal level. Will always be the smartest person in the room. His classes are not for the weak minded and those lacking self confidence. His intelligence is inspiring and overwhelming.
Best professor I ever had in my entire college career. He was the reason I stayed at OSU from my m. Arch. So smart, so funny, so insightful. I spent as much time as possible with this man.
very confusing and hard.

His jibber jabber is sometimes incomprehensible.  He teaches about arch in a purely theoretical perspective. It's so wishy washy that it makes me sick to listen to him lecture.  He barely teaches practicality at all.  Don't expect to understand the real world of architecture after class/studio with this man.

if you put doug on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire, he'd be like "ugh" and answer anything like it was ABCs, hes that smart, but yeah he will shred your projects and ideas to pieces, but he has 1000 good reasons for it....
Great teacher, but tends to be a pain. If your not careful he'll run all over your project
Interesting but very challenging.  Great quotes to remember for years.

Most intelligent and interesting person i've come across in arch school so far.  ALL about the idea, ALL about using simple language to create complexity.  It can be extremely difficult , but you'll learn alot in the process about what you thought was architecture.  Plus his subtle humor is hilarious.
No Comments
probably the smartest man alive. the classes are hillarious, especially his recitations. unfortunately, the class screws up almost everyone's gpa.
Very VERY intelligent. LOVES banal, beyonce, and Aunt Wanda. Grades incredibly hard, but then again its theory.
Hilarious in that really really dry sense of humor kinda way.

summary_comment: Jeff is highly regarded by many students for his profound impact on their thinking and understanding of architecture, though his teaching style is often described as challenging and direct. Some students find him a poor role model due to personal behavior issues, while others appreciate his expertise and ability to engage even early-morning classes. His lectures are seen as both intellectually stimulating and potentially discouraging, depending on one's ability to handle his critical and sometimes harsh feedback. Despite mixed reviews, many students credit him with transforming their perspectives and

Ratings.comment: Jeff got put on leave for a semester for sniffing a girls hair. He also is a bad teacher that is more concerned with hearing himself speak than he is with his students.
Jeff is tough, but if you can take his classes without taking his comments personally you will learn so much. You will come out of a Kipnis class a much better thinker.

everyone is in love with this guy but i honestly don't know why. he makes up things as he goes along and people ride his garbage because they are afraid to upset him, hes just politically connected. that doesn't make a good teacher. if you like make believe architecture unicorns and no gravity, then take him.

He may keep the class interesting at 8 in the morning, but in reality all I learned from him is what HE thought was great architecture. I would like to be taught by someone who at least went to school for ARCH let alone is actually licensed. He made it perfectly clear you either agreed with his view on who was a good architect or you're an idiot.

Such a great Prof! I took the class in the spring so by then the TAs were lecturing more than half of the classes. But, Jeff is such an interesting prof it was one of few classes that I was excited to attend. Generally and easy class/prof just study the sides some before the final and you will have no problem passing the class.

The smartest man I've ever met. One class with Jeff and you wonder why you've wasted your money with any other professor. He IS direct and often harsh, but this is the man to take if you want to begin to really understand architecture. If you go through OSU's architecture program and don't take anything with Jeff, you're an idiot.

Jeff changes lives. He is without equal in the world of architectural theory. One of the most enlightening people I have ever met. He's also quite likely to belittle you and disregard anything you say as idiotic, but that's usually because it is...comparatively. I would happily pay triple to be able to take him again. Better hurry before he retires

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as ineffective and disorganized, with many students finding her lectures unengaging and irrelevant to the course material. Students consistently report low attendance due to boredom and the lack of clear communication from the professor. While some appreciate the creative freedom in assignments, the overall experience is overwhelmingly negative, marked by unreliability, poor organization, and a general sense of disarray in both teaching and communication.

Ratings.comment: if you dont hate yourself,DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! More than half of the students dont even show up in most of the lectures. Her assignments are unrelated to her class materials at all. I didnt learn anything from her teaching.
This prof is so ridiculously scatterbrained and loony that she should be teaching at Michigan.
You will find yourself not going to class, because she is so dreadfully boring. She is a representative of google earth and that is mostly what you will hear about in her lectures.

She is very unorganized, but the good thing is that her assignments allow for creativity, there is no "cookie cutter" assignment, which ultimately allows you to be a better designer, creator, etc. BE FREINDS WITH THE TA! They are your only route to actually communicate with her. DOES NOT RESPONT TO EMAIL, your best bet is to ask questions in class.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! This teacher is a total whack job that should not be teaching at a university...let alone at all. She doesn't ever seem to have it together and she is all over the place in her lectures so you never know what's on the test. Horrible GEC! Hopefully you see this before you take her--I sure wish I had looked first!
useless professor, rarely shows up for class and late when she does. THIS IS NOT AN EASY GEC, take something else!!!

She says she will do something and then doesn't.  For instance she said she would post something by noon that day, and it was emailed me the next day at 7pm.  She also did not come to class 2 days that we were scheduled to.  She was also late another 3 or 4 days.

I hated this class. I found the lectures to be terribly boring and disorganized. The assignments seemed poorly designed, and I felt the primary research papers would be more appropriate for a sociology class. Everything from the handouts to the power point presentations were outrageously vague and lacking in focus. I would not recommend this class.

Prof=joke.  Shows up to class 20 min late at least once a week, lectures are pointless-she uses the same slides in different powerpoints presentations, doesn't know how to pronounce/is surprised by what is on slides, has wordrobe malfunctions-bra and belly showing, cancels/moves assignments back(i'm not complaining about this one). Do assignments=A

Unfortunately, I am going to be seeing a lot of this women. Most of her lectures have nothing to do with the class! She is always having a wardrobe malfunction (belly hanging out, stained clothing, NO BRA! ect.) Overall she is so boring and teaches too many classes!

Unfortunately you can not avoid her if you are in the larch program.  I know there is a prof shortage in land arch...but SHE HAS TO GO!! She will make you want to quit the program. So far the worst day of my life in the larch program was when I found out that she was going to be our prof again for the next quarter. I curled in a ball and cryed.

The most disorganized and disheveled professor with tenure. As long as you do the first or second assignment...you've got yourself an 'A' because she will cancel the rest of your assignments...including the exams. Good luck surviving through lectures with absolutely no point.

A day did not go by where I didn't hate her.  She has THE most boring lectures, was more late to class than I was (thats hard to do), and never gave assigments back on time. Actually, I think she made a lot of it up as she went. She was the most unorganized teacher ever. Who has the last name george with no E anyways!? big red flag!

Worst teacher ever...still haven't gotten my papers back from last quarter because her leg keeps falling asleep on her and she has no time to get them around.  She was always late to class or canceling it all together
Very disorganized, don't have to go to lecture, covers entire exam on day of review, word for word.  Papers semi-easy.

Very unorganized teacher, extremely boring classes, really stupid projects/papers, and incredibly vague with all assignments. Dont have to go to class and the midterm and final are incredibly easy but are only worth 25% of class combined. Harder than expected, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
Worst teacher ever never on schedule, hardly ever shows up, and messes up your grades all the time.  Queen of incompletes!!

I took this class as a GEC and it required much more work than I expected. She made it very difficult with very boring lectures and terrible instructions. She can't work the lights so at least that wastes half the class time. Look for another GEC if possible. I pity you architecture students.
She is the most unorganized prof. i have ever had.  I would not recommend her to my worst enemy!
No Comments
This class was boring but you don't need to go to class too often.  Two boring research projects and thats all you really have to worry about.
Gave me a lower grade than I deserved. She said she would look into it, never did anything about it. Easy class, but what a pain.
dear god avoid her at all costs
"Times new roman font is making a come back."
She's such a super lady!

summary_comment: Brayton is an outstanding instructor known for his deep knowledge and challenging approach to teaching. He focuses heavily on theory, providing students with new and essential information. His emphasis on high-quality graphics and thoroughness in assignments is evident. Students find his teaching rigorous but highly beneficial. Overall, he is widely praised for his effectiveness and impact on the curriculum.

Ratings.comment: Brayton was an excellent instructor who was very knowledgeable and really challenged our studio section. He is very theory driven, so it was definitely new information that was difficult but important for us to learn. He really emphasizes good graphics and not being lazy with assignments. I learned a lot and I hope Knowlton keeps him as a teacher.

summary_comment: Galo is a talented professor known for his clear direction in guiding students, though his feedback tends to be vague and sometimes comes across as intentionally aloof. His teaching approach can lack engagement, particularly in introductory courses, which may reflect his own relative inexperience. Students note that final grades are only released at the semester's end and not posted online, adding to the uncertainty. Overall, while he offers valuable insights, his teaching style and communication could be more polished and supportive.

Ratings.comment: Galo is young and brilliant, but he also lacks some of the qualities of an outstanding professor. He gives good direction but vague feedback, almost like he is really trying to be aloof. He seemed bored teaching first year studio, and that's understandable. You won't know your grade until the end of the semester because he did not put them online.

summary_comment: Stephen is a highly respected and knowledgeable professor known for his deep understanding of architecture. He sets high standards and challenges students to think critically, though his teaching style can be abstract and difficult to adjust to initially. While some students appreciate his expansive ideas and passion for the subject, others find his methods outdated and confusing, leading to frustration and low grades. Despite mixed reviews, many acknowledge his intelligence and ability to provide a rich, theoretical discussion.

Ratings.comment: Stephen is a great and caring professor. His teaching style is different than most Knowlton professors and takes some time to get adjusted to. He has very high expectations and can be hard to please. At the end of his studio, you are sure to have a great project.

He is teaching outdated stuff for every single studio without changing it, and it's like an equation without and you have to do it. He only believes in his stuff and is unable to give students freedom.
If you believe architecture is pure white, fake and chaotic space,  choose him, you are not going to know what architecture really is. But his methodology will help you find sth new.

He is one of the more respected teachers in the arch dept. It is easy to see why. He is clear, concise, and drives students with a passion for architecture. He is the kind of teacher to have a casual conversation as well as an in depth theoretical discussion.

He is very smart!Yes, maybe you are right he can be abstract, but just in a way to explain you the idea from the different points of view. And because he knows TONS OF stuff it takes time, but it's very helpful. He likes an walking encyclopaedia
Very nice and very smart but sometimes very abstract.  Great if you're looking for very expansive ideas.

He's definitely an aging hipster. It seemed like there was a lot of information being thrown around, but much of it was totally useless. Many of my classmates complained about the total obscurity from which exam questions would arise. "Did we even talk about that?" was a common refrain. Nice guy, interesting to talk to, don't take his class though.

The class swung from very engaging to totally banal. THe real downfall though was that everyone seemed to get a much lower grade than all of their work seemed to indicate. He knows his stuff, just not that great on passing it on to the student.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is known for delivering high-quality education with a rigorous curriculum that requires significant effort from students. The workload is substantial but perceived as fair, with clear expectations and reasonable grading criteria. Students appreciate the thoroughness of the course material and the depth of knowledge imparted. Overall, the teaching quality is highly regarded, fostering a deep understanding of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: Lots of work but fair

summary_comment: Rob is an exceptionally thorough Studio instructor who meticulously remembers every detail of his students' projects. He genuinely cares about each student's work and pushes them to excel, often requiring significant effort and preparation. Students must show respect and be well-prepared, leading to many late nights, but the rewards are substantial. Overall, Rob is highly regarded as one of the best instructors in terms of teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: Rob was the best Studio instructor I have had. He is incredibly thorough and remembers every detail from your project (for better or worse.) He legitimately cares about each student's work but makes you work for it. Show him respect and always have what he asks (be prepared for a lot of late nights) and the reward will be worth it.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as ineffective in teaching math-based concepts, frequently getting confused during lectures and requiring corrections. Her marking is described as inconsistent and unclear, and she is noted for being disorganized and lacking a clear rubric. Students found her to be unhelpful in providing clear guidance and often turned to teaching assistants for support. Additionally, several students found her to be rude and harsh during critiques, with one describing her as "insanely disorganized" and "horribly unclear." Overall

Ratings.comment: It's a math based class and she's awful at math.  She gets confused during her own lectures and has to back track to figure out where she messed up.  Not a bad juror in reviews, but truly an awful structures prof.  I learned more from the TA's than I did from her.
Most inconsistent and unclear marking throughout the quarter i have ever had. Very unhelpful and to put it frankly is not a very nice person
Not that helpful. She gives suggestions but isnt that clear on them. She is really nice but doesnt seem to know what she is talking about.

great drawing skill.

Awful teacher. Nice. Nice lady. INSANLEY disorganized. No rubric whatsoever. Completely inconsistent. Horribly unclear and vague. Rude and mostly ingnorant when it came to crits. No such thing as a positive crit. poor teacher. quit your job.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as exceptional, with students consistently praising their high level of expertise and teaching quality. They are considered one of, if not the best, instructors in the landscape architecture program. Their ability to convey complex concepts effectively and engage students is particularly noted. Students appreciate the depth of knowledge and the practical approach to teaching. Overall, they are highly respected for enhancing the educational experience significantly.

Ratings.comment: Excellent
Probably the best prof in the land arch program.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by an unwavering commitment to helping students. He demonstrates remarkable talent in leveraging technology to enhance the learning experience. Most notably, his dedication to working tirelessly with students' ideas sets him apart as a truly exceptional educator. Students consistently praise his eagerness to assist, making him a standout figure among faculty members.

Ratings.comment: Great Prof very eager to help students, and talented with technology. His willingness to work with his students ideas tirelessly sets him apart from your average professor.
